review: So far, I am enjoying the features of the Fire Stick. What I am disappointed in is the lag. I can watch netflix from any computer or device in my home without issue. With the Fire Stick, I have intermittent connection issues, and the audio seems to get slightly out of sync with the video. I have also gotten the "buffering" warning when watching Prime Video, which also has no issues from a laptop or tablet.

author: Jeff E.

review: Purchased just before Christmas 2014, Worked well enough for the first several months.I had the power brick hooked up to an outlet that turned off when my receiver was turned off, and I found that while it would boot up and stream amazon content almost immediately, 60% of the time i would have to wait 5 minutes to stream content from Netflix.  I would simply get a "title is not available right now" message for all Netflix content, even though i could view said titles via a laptop at the same time.  I grew tired of this, so I put it on a different plug that would not force a power cycle.Later, I found that I had to power cycle the unit every few days anyway, as it would start freezing the graphics on a stream for a few seconds, and then playing in fast forward until it caught up.  This pausing would continue until i unplugged the unit, let it cool down for five minutes, then plugged it back in; this would typically grant me another few hours of non-paused viewing.  A few weeks ago the picture would occasionally start to grain up, as though I was watching on an analog TV in a rural area in the 1990's.  Twice today the Fire TV Stick stopped sending a signal to my television at all until it was unplugged and cooled down, I think that I am reaching the end of my unit's lifespan.  I know people who have been using chromecast and rokus for  significantly longer than our Fire TV Stick, and have not heard complaints from them of this nature.  Hopefully the stick will brick up completely in the next few months, as I worry that since the problem seems to be intermittent after hours of use I don't know that the warranty service will find anything to repair.
